result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary E. Skurzewski

records.addlTxt: Processed Financial Request Form
FRF sent to DB

ADDRESS INFO for Gary E. Skurzewski
Current: 4105 Stewart Ave. Apt 5, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 308 Jensen St # 105, Athens, WI 54411

AMENDED. Not allowed to operate a motor vehicle. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:15 a.m.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Heather Roehr.
Date and time set for a review hearing.
VRCW. 

COURT reviews history of the case.
Atty Roehr indicates her client met with protective services and they are not seeking a guardianship at this time, requests a dismissal, if not, requests a reduction in the cash bond.
ADA Lech objects to the dismissal of the case, but does not object to modifying the bond to a high signature bond.
Parties discuss the status of Defendant's DL.
COURT continues the suspension of the case for 6 months, and directs parties to schedule another review hearing with JA.
COURT grants motion to amend bond to a $2,500.00 signature bond, same conditions as previously ordered.

Adjourned: 9:20 a.m.
Review hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Not allowed to operate a motor vehicle. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 11:12 a.m.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Heather Roehr.
VRCW. 

Parties do not object to the findings of the report.
ADA Lech notes Corp Counsel does not think a chapter 51 is necessary.
Atty Roehr notes her client has an appointment with the Dept of SS next week.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT suspends proceedings, requests parties to schedule a future appointment so the COURT is aware of what happened with his meeting with Dept of SS.
Bond continues. with the additional condition of: Not allowed to operate a motor vehicle.

DATES:
RH: 8/4/22 @ 9:15 a.m.

Adjourned: 11:24 a.m.
Steven A. Benson, PhD

No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
